intro: Senecio spribillei, commonly known as the Spribille's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically arranged in a dense, circular pattern. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
